title.narrative: BD Chittagong Water Supply Improvement and Sanitation Project

description.narrative: The revised PDO is to increase access to safe water and improve CWASA's institutional capacity and investment planning for sanitation and drainage in Chittagong City.

participating-org.narrative: Chittagong Water Supply and Sewerage Authority (CWASA)

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :FA, Schedule 2, Section V (1) | Description: The Recipient shall enter into a Performance Contract with CWASAdetailing the respective parties' obligations and responsibilities under the project | Due Date: 27-Apr-2011

Finance Agreement :FA, Schedule, Section II (B)(3) | Description: CWASA shall have its financial statements audited by independentauditors acceptable to the Association, in accordance with consistently applied auditing standards acceptable to the Association.Each Audit of these financial statements shall cover the period of one fiscal year. The audited financial statements for eachperiod shall be furnished to the Association not later than six (6) months afte | Frequency: Yearly
Finance Agreement :PA, Schedule, Section I (A) (1) | Description: CWASA shall constitute a Project Audit Committee to meet at leasttwice a year to review CWASA's audit reports | Due Date: 30-Jun-2011

Finance Agreement :PA, Schedule, Section I (A) (1) | Description: CWASA shall establish a PMU, led by a Project Director, toberesponsible for the coordination and the overall management, implementation and supervision of the Project | Due Date: 27-Jan-2011

Finance Agreement :PA, Schedule, Section II (A)(1)(a) | Description: CWASA shall monitor and evaluate the progress of the projectand prepare project reports for the project. Each such Project Report shall cover the period of one calendar semester, and shall befurnished to the Bank not later than forty-five (45) days after the end of the period covered by such report. | Frequency: Yearly

Finance Agreement :PA, Schedule, Section IV (1) | Description: CWASA shall report not later than 6 months after end of each of itsfiscal years on progress toward achieving the targets stipulated in the Performance Contract | Frequency: Yearly

title.narrative: Improved community water points constructed or rehabilitated under the project
Piped household water connections that are benefiting from rehabilitation works undertaken by the project
Number of other water service providers that the project is supporting
Number of staff trained as per approved staff training and development program
Number of zonal offices refurbished and equipped under the project
Total value of priority sanitation and drainage investments identified, prepared and ready for financing
Number of water utilities that the project is supporting
Number of people in urban areas provided with access to Improved Water Sources under the Project
Volume of safe water produced by CWASA (Million liters per day - MLD)
Percentage of instituional capacity development activities supported by the project that are completed
Volume of safe water sold/billed by CWASA (Million liters per year # MLY)
New piped household connections that are resulting from project intervention
CWASA achieve O&M cost coverage from direct water sales revenues
Commercial management plan prepared and approved by CWASA Board
Customer services improvement plan prepared and approved by CWASA Board

Management information systems plan prepared and approved by CWASA Board
Staff training and development program prepared and approved by CWASA Board
New organogram prepared and approved by CWASA board
Sanitation and drainage strategy and master plan prepared and approved by CWASA board
Standard operating procedures and O&M manuals prepared and staff trained in their use
